topics.body:
Well I gave the female Thor comic a chance. I read the entire first trade paperback.

...I didn't like it. It was okay at best.

Positives: good art

Fem thors first moments figuring out the hammer were amusing and fun.

Negatives: 

Odin was a sexist douchenugget. I haven't read a lot of thor, but I don't remember him ever acting like that. Especially to his wife. Freya is shown as really wise and kind, while Odin is just mad and rude.  Hmmmmmmmmmm....

It takes alot to get me to call something a Mary Sue, but fem Thor really did have Sue qaulities in the writing. She could beat up enemies single-handed, with little experience, that the avengers couldn't as a team. And the hammer flew around far better her than it ever did for thor...cause.

Alot of things seemed to be arranged to show her as awesome, at the expense of other characters. Odin suffers this haaaaard.

Then there's the anvilicousness of issue 4. the one with absorbing man on the day I'm quite sure he went to a straw mill.


I found myself wanting to know more about thors journey than hers. Him accepting that he no longer wields the hammer, coming to terms with this shattering event.

The writing is okay. Just okay.




Gonna go read Ms Marvel to get this taste out of my mouth. Begh.
topics.author: 500757fd7f123b75a90003b1

topics.body: ^Didn't the fem thor get cancelled?
